            <textarea id="taskInput" rows="3" placeholder="e.g., 'Create a marketing campaign for a new product, including visuals and a launch plan.'"></textarea>
            <button id="startWorkflowBtn">Start Quantum Workflow</button>
            <button id="refineOutputBtn" class="ml-2 bg-gradient-to-r from-purple-500 to-indigo-500" disabled>Refine Output</button>
            <div id="agiStatus" class="mt-4 text-center text-lg font-bold"></div>
        </div>

        <!-- Workflow Visualization -->
        <div class="card">
            <div class="section-title">Workflow Harmonization & Progress</div>
            <div id="workflowSteps" class="mb-4">
                <div id="step1" class="workflow-step"><span class="workflow-icon"></span> Intent Harmonization: Establishing Quantum Intent State</div>
                <div id="step2" class="workflow-step"><span class="workflow-icon"></span> Task Decomposition & Agent Entanglement: Building Resonant Connections</div>
                <div id="step3" class="workflow-step"><span class="workflow-icon"></span> Parallelized Execution & State Superposition: Exploring Solution Space</div>
                <div id="step4" class="workflow-step"><span class="workflow-icon"></span> Coherence Collapse & Output Synthesis: Converging to Optimal Form</div>
                <div id="step5" class="workflow-step"><span class="workflow-icon"></span> Iterative Refinement & Harmonic Re-equilibration: Enhancing Resonance</div>
            </div>
            <div class="coherence-meter">
                <div id="coherenceBar" class="coherence-bar"></div>
            </div>
            <div id="dissonanceIndicator" class="dissonance-indicator">Dissonance Detected! Re-equilibration needed.</div>
        </div>

        <!-- Internal Agent Modes Grid -->
        <div class="grid grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-2 gap-4">
            <!-- App Synthesizer Agent -->
            <div id="appSynthesizerCard" class="card opacity-50 pointer-events-none">
                <div class="section-title text-cyan-400">App Synthesizer (Opal-inspired)</div>
                <p class="mb-2 text-sm opacity-80">Generates conceptual app ideas or automated workflows.</p>
                <input type="text" id="appPrompt" placeholder="Describe a mini-app (e.g., 'AI thumbnail generator')" disabled>
                <button id="generateAppBtn" disabled>Synthesize App</button>
                <div id="appOutput" class="mt-4 p-3 bg-gray-800 rounded-lg text-sm whitespace-pre-wrap scrollable-output"></div>
                <div id="appLoading" class="loading-spinner hidden"></div>
            </div>

            <!-- Strategic Planner Agent -->
            <div id="strategicPlannerCard" class="card opacity-50 pointer-events-none">
                <div class="section-title text-fuchsia-400">Strategic Planner (ChatGPT Agent-inspired)</div>
                <p class="mb-2 text-sm opacity-80">Develops multi-step plans and problem-solving strategies.</p>
                <input type="text" id="plannerPrompt" placeholder="Enter a problem (e.g., 'Optimize travel costs for a family of 4')" disabled>
                <button id="planStrategyBtn" disabled>Plan Strategy</button>
                <div id="plannerOutput" class="mt-4 p-3 bg-gray-800 rounded-lg text-sm whitespace-pre-wrap scrollable-output"></div>
                <div id="plannerLoading" class="loading-spinner hidden"></div>
            </div>

            <!-- Creative Modulator Agent -->
            <div id="creativeModulatorCard" class="card opacity-50 pointer-events-none">
                <div class="section-title text-yellow-400">Creative Modulator (Firefly-inspired)</div>
                <p class="mb-2 text-sm opacity-80">Generates creative assets (text, conceptual visuals).</p>
                <input type="text" id="creativePrompt" placeholder="Describe a creative asset (e.g., 'futuristic logo for a tech company')" disabled>
                <button id="modulateCreativeBtn" disabled>Modulate Creative</button>
                <div id="creativeOutput" class="mt-4 p-3 bg-gray-800 rounded-lg text-sm whitespace-pre-wrap scrollable-output"></div>
                <div id="creativeLoading" class="loading-spinner hidden"></div>
            </div>

            <!-- Knowledge Base Display -->
            <div class="card">
                <div class="section-title text-white">Knowledge Base (Simulated Quantum State Space)</div>
                <p class="mb-2 text-sm opacity-80">Dynamic access and learning from simulated knowledge states.</p>
                <div id="knowledgeBaseDisplay" class="mt-4 p-3 bg-gray-800 rounded-lg text-sm h-32 overflow-y-auto scrollable-output">
                    <p class="kb-update">Initial knowledge state loaded: Quantum Harmonic Principles, Agent Interaction Models.</p>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>

        <!-- Final Output -->
        <div class="card">
            <div class="section-title">Final Coherent Output</div>
            <p class="mb-2 text-sm opacity-80">The synthesized, harmonically aligned solution for your task.</p>
            <div id="finalOutput" class="mt-4 p-3 bg-gray-800 rounded-lg text-base whitespace-pre-wrap min-h-[100px] scrollable-output">
                Awaiting workflow completion...
            </div>
        </div>
    </div>

    <script>
        // --- Configuration and Constants ---
        // API key for Gemini API - leave empty string, Canvas will provide it at runtime
        const API_KEY = "";
        const GEMINI_API_URL = `https://generativelanguage.googleapis.com/v1beta/models/gemini-2.0-flash:generateContent?key=${API_KEY}`;
        const MAX_RETRIES = 3; // Max retries for API calls
        const RETRY_DELAY_MS = 1000; // Delay between retries in milliseconds

        // --- DOM Elements ---
        const taskInput = document.getElementById('taskInput');
        const startWorkflowBtn = document.getElementById('startWorkflowBtn');
        const refineOutputBtn = document.getElementById('refineOutputBtn');
        const agiStatus = document.getElementById('agiStatus');
        const workflowSteps = document.getElementById('workflowSteps').children;
        const coherenceBar = document.getElementById('coherenceBar');
        const dissonanceIndicator = document.getElementById('dissonanceIndicator');

        const appSynthesizerCard = document.getElementById('appSynthesizerCard');
        const appPrompt = document.getElementById('appPrompt');
        const generateAppBtn = document.getElementById('generateAppBtn');
        const appOutput = document.getElementById('appOutput');
        const appLoading = document.getElementById('appLoading');

        const strategicPlannerCard = document.getElementById('strategicPlannerCard');
        const plannerPrompt = document.getElementById('plannerPrompt');
        const planStrategyBtn = document.getElementById('planStrategyBtn');
        const plannerOutput = document.getElementById('plannerOutput');
        const plannerLoading = document.getElementById('plannerLoading');

        const creativeModulatorCard = document.getElementById('creativeModulatorCard');
        const creativePrompt = document.getElementById('creativePrompt');
        const modulateCreativeBtn = document.getElementById('modulateCreativeBtn');
        const creativeOutput = document.getElementById('creativeOutput');
        const creativeLoading = document.getElementById('creativeLoading');

        const knowledgeBaseDisplay = document.getElementById('knowledgeBaseDisplay');
        const finalOutput = document.getElementById('finalOutput');

        // --- State Variables ---
        let currentCoherence = 0;
        let workflowActive = false;
        let agentPromises = []; // To track parallel agent tasks
        let activeAgents = []; // To track which agents are enabled for a given task

        // --- Utility Functions ---

        /**
         * Simulates a delay to represent processing time.
         * @param {number} ms - Milliseconds to delay.
         */
        const delay = (ms) => new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, ms));

        /**
         * Updates the workflow step UI.
         * @param {number} stepIndex - The 0-based index of the step.
         * @param {string} status - 'active', 'completed', or '' (for reset).
         * @param {string} message - Optional message for the status.
         */
        const updateWorkflowStepUI = (stepIndex, status, message = '') => {
            if (workflowSteps[stepIndex]) {
                Array.from(workflowSteps).forEach((step, idx) => {
                    step.classList.remove('active', 'completed');
                    if (idx === stepIndex && status === 'active') {
                        step.classList.add('active');
                    } else if (idx < stepIndex || (idx === stepIndex && status === 'completed')) {
                        step.classList.add('completed');
                    }
                });
                if (message) {
                    agiStatus.textContent = message;
                }
            }
        };

        /**
         * Updates the coherence meter and dissonance indicator.
         * @param {number} value - New coherence value (0-100).
         * @param {boolean} showDissonance - Whether to show the dissonance indicator.
         */
        const updateCoherenceUI = (value, showDissonance = false) => {
            currentCoherence = Math.max(0, Math.min(100, value)); // Ensure value is between 0 and 100
            coherenceBar.style.width = `${currentCoherence}%`;
            dissonanceIndicator.classList.toggle('active', showDissonance);
        };

        /**
         * Enables/disables an agent card and its inputs/buttons.
         * Also adds a visual 'active-agent' class.
         * @param {HTMLElement} cardElement - The agent card div.
         * @param {boolean} enable - True to enable, false to disable.
         */
        const toggleAgentCard = (cardElement, enable) => {
            cardElement.classList.toggle('opacity-50', !enable);
            cardElement.classList.toggle('pointer-events-none', !enable);
            cardElement.classList.toggle('active-agent', enable); /* Add glow */
            const inputs = cardElement.querySelectorAll('input, button');
            inputs.forEach(input => input.disabled = !enable);
        };

        /**
         * Adds a message to the knowledge base display.
         * @param {string} message - The message to add.
         * @param {string} colorClass - Tailwind color class for the text.
         */
        const addKnowledgeBaseUpdate = (message, colorClass = 'text-gray-300') => {
            const p = document.createElement('p');
            p.className = `kb-update text-xs mt-2 ${colorClass}`;
            p.textContent = `[${new Date().toLocaleTimeString()}] ${message}`;
            knowledgeBaseDisplay.appendChild(p);
            knowledgeBaseDisplay.scrollTop = knowledgeBaseDisplay.scrollHeight; // Scroll to bottom
        };

        /**
         * Calls the Gemini API to generate content with retry mechanism.
         * @param {string} prompt - The prompt for the LLM.
         * @param {number} retries - Current retry count.
         * @returns {Promise<string>} - The generated text.
         */
        const callGeminiAPI = async (prompt, retries = 0) => {
            let chatHistory = [];
            chatHistory.push({ role: "user", parts: [{ text: prompt }] });
            const payload = { contents: chatHistory };

            try {
                const response = await fetch(GEMINI_API_URL, {
                    method: 'POST',
                    headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' },
                    body: JSON.stringify(payload)
                });

                if (!response.ok) {
                    const errorText = await response.text();
                    throw new Error(`HTTP error! status: ${response.status}, message: ${errorText}`);
                }

                const result = await response.json();

                if (result.candidates && result.candidates.length > 0 &&
                    result.candidates[0].content && result.candidates[0].content.parts &&
                    result.candidates[0].content.parts.length > 0) {
                    return result.candidates[0].content.parts[0].text;
                } else {
                    throw new Error('Unexpected API response structure or no content.');
                }
            } catch (error) {
                console.error(`Attempt ${retries + 1} failed:`, error);
                if (retries < MAX_RETRIES) {
                    await delay(RETRY_DELAY_MS * (retries + 1)); // Exponential backoff
                    return callGeminiAPI(prompt, retries + 1);
                } else {
                    throw new Error(`Failed to connect to generation service after ${MAX_RETRIES} retries: ${error.message}`);
                }
            }
        };

        // --- Agent Mode Functions ---

        /**
         * Simulates the App Synthesizer agent's operation.
         * @param {string} prompt - The user's prompt for app synthesis.
         */
        const runAppSynthesizer = async (prompt) => {
            toggleAgentCard(appSynthesizerCard, true); // Keep active during its run
            appLoading.classList.remove('hidden');
            appOutput.textContent = 'Synthesizing app idea... (Establishing coherent quantum state for app concept)';
            try {
                const generatedContent = await callGeminiAPI(`Generate a conceptual mini-app idea based on this description: "${prompt}". Focus on its purpose, key features, and potential user benefit. Keep it concise, around 50-70 words. Mention 'prime quantum compression' or 'infinite context' if relevant.`);
                appOutput.textContent = generatedContent;
                addKnowledgeBaseUpdate(`App concept synthesized: "${prompt.substring(0, 30)}..."`, 'text-cyan-300');
                updateCoherenceUI(currentCoherence + 15); // Increase coherence
            } catch (error) {
                appOutput.textContent = `App Synthesizer Error: ${error.message}`;
                addKnowledgeBaseUpdate(`App Synthesizer failed: ${error.message}`, 'text-red-400');
                updateCoherenceUI(currentCoherence - 10, true); // Decrease coherence, show dissonance
            } finally {
                appLoading.classList.add('hidden');
                toggleAgentCard(appSynthesizerCard, false); // Deactivate after run
            }
        };

        /**
         * Simulates the Strategic Planner agent's operation.
         * @param {string} prompt - The user's prompt for strategic planning.
         */
        const runStrategicPlanner = async (prompt) => {
            toggleAgentCard(strategicPlannerCard, true); // Keep active during its run
            plannerLoading.classList.remove('hidden');
            plannerOutput.textContent = 'Planning strategy... (Executing unitary transformation for optimal path)';
            try {
                const generatedContent = await callGeminiAPI(`Develop a multi-step strategic plan to address this problem: "${prompt}". Outline the key steps, potential challenges, and expected outcomes. Keep it concise, around 70-100 words. Mention 'harmonic optimization' or 'entangled sub-tasks'.`);
                plannerOutput.textContent = generatedContent;
                addKnowledgeBaseUpdate(`Strategic plan generated for: "${prompt.substring(0, 30)}..."`, 'text-fuchsia-300');
                updateCoherenceUI(currentCoherence + 20); // Increase coherence
            } catch (error) {
                plannerOutput.textContent = `Strategic Planner Error: ${error.message}`;
                addKnowledgeBaseUpdate(`Strategic Planner failed: ${error.message}`, 'text-red-400');
                updateCoherenceUI(currentCoherence - 15, true); // Decrease coherence, show dissonance
            } finally {
                plannerLoading.classList.add('hidden');
                toggleAgentCard(strategicPlannerCard, false); // Deactivate after run
            }
        };

        /**
         * Simulates the Creative Modulator agent's operation.
         * @param {string} prompt - The user's prompt for creative generation.
         */
        const runCreativeModulator = async (prompt) => {
            toggleAgentCard(creativeModulatorCard, true); // Keep active during its run
            creativeLoading.classList.remove('hidden');
            creativeOutput.textContent = 'Modulating creative output... (Exploring creative quantum fluctuations)';
            try {
                const generatedContent = await callGeminiAPI(`Generate a conceptual description for a creative asset based on: "${prompt}". Describe its visual style, mood, and key elements. Keep it concise, around 60-90 words. Reference 'quantum-enhanced' or 'resonant frequencies'.`);
                creativeOutput.textContent = generatedContent;
                addKnowledgeBaseUpdate(`Creative asset modulated for: "${prompt.substring(0, 30)}..."`, 'text-yellow-300');
                updateCoherenceUI(currentCoherence + 10); // Increase coherence
            } catch (error) {
                creativeOutput.textContent = `Creative Modulator Error: ${error.message}`;
                addKnowledgeBaseUpdate(`Creative Modulator failed: ${error.message}`, 'text-red-400');
                updateCoherenceUI(currentCoherence - 5, true); // Decrease coherence, show dissonance
            } finally {
                creativeLoading.classList.add('hidden');
                toggleAgentCard(creativeModulatorCard, false); // Deactivate after run
            }
        };

        /**
         * Determines which agents to activate based on the task input.
         * @param {string} task - The user's main task.
         * @returns {Array<string>} - List of agent IDs to activate.
         */
        const determineActiveAgents = (task) => {
            const lowerTask = task.toLowerCase();
            const agents = [];

            if (lowerTask.includes('app') || lowerTask.includes('workflow') || lowerTask.includes('automation')) {
                agents.push('appSynthesizer');
            }
            if (lowerTask.includes('plan') || lowerTask.includes('strategy') || lowerTask.includes('optimize') || lowerTask.includes('solution') || lowerTask.includes('problem')) {
                agents.push('strategicPlanner');
            }
            if (lowerTask.includes('visuals') || lowerTask.includes('design') || lowerTask.includes('creative') || lowerTask.includes('content') || lowerTask.includes('media')) {
                agents.push('creativeModulator');
            }
            
            // If no specific keywords, activate all by default for a general task
            if (agents.length === 0) {
                return ['appSynthesizer', 'strategicPlanner', 'creativeModulator'];
            }
            return agents;
        };

        /**
         * Orchestrates the quantum-harmonic workflow.
         * @param {boolean} isRefinement - True if this is a refinement run.
         */
        const startQuantumWorkflow = async (isRefinement = false) => {
            if (workflowActive && !isRefinement) return; // Prevent multiple simultaneous workflows unless it's a refinement
            
            if (!isRefinement) {
                resetUI();
            }
            workflowActive = true;
            startWorkflowBtn.disabled = true;
            refineOutputBtn.disabled = true;
            taskInput.disabled = true;
            
            const userTask = taskInput.value.trim();
            if (!userTask) {
                agiStatus.textContent = 'Please enter a task for the AGI.';
                startWorkflowBtn.disabled = false;
                taskInput.disabled = false;
                workflowActive = false;
                return;
            }

            if (!isRefinement) {
                agiStatus.textContent = 'Sovereign AGI: Initiating Workflow...';
                updateCoherenceUI(10); // Initial coherence

                // Step 1: Intent Harmonization
                updateWorkflowStepUI(0, 'active', 'Sovereign AGI: Harmonizing Intent (Establishing Quantum Intent State)...');
                await delay(1500);
                updateWorkflowStepUI(0, 'completed');
                updateCoherenceUI(30);
                addKnowledgeBaseUpdate('Intent Harmonization complete. Quantum Intent State established.', 'text-green-400');

                // Step 2: Task Decomposition & Agent Entanglement
                updateWorkflowStepUI(1, 'active', 'Sovereign AGI: Decomposing Task & Entangling Agents (Building Resonant Connections)...');
                await delay(2000);
                updateWorkflowStepUI(1, 'completed');
                updateCoherenceUI(50);
                addKnowledgeBaseUpdate('Task decomposed. Agents entangled, resonant connections established.', 'text-green-400');
                
                // Determine and enable relevant agents
                activeAgents = determineActiveAgents(userTask);
                if (activeAgents.includes('appSynthesizer')) toggleAgentCard(appSynthesizerCard, true);
                if (activeAgents.includes('strategicPlanner')) toggleAgentCard(strategicPlannerCard, true);
                if (activeAgents.includes('creativeModulator')) toggleAgentCard(creativeModulatorCard, true);

                // Populate agent prompts based on the main task input
                appPrompt.value = `A mini-app related to "${userTask}"`;
                plannerPrompt.value = `Plan for "${userTask}"`;
                creativePrompt.value = `Creative assets for "${userTask}"`;

            } else {
                agiStatus.textContent = 'Sovereign AGI: Initiating Refinement Cycle...';
                updateCoherenceUI(currentCoherence * 0.8); // Drop coherence slightly for refinement start
                updateWorkflowStepUI(4, 'active', 'Sovereign AGI: Performing Iterative Refinement (Re-equilibration in progress)...');
                await delay(1000);
            }

            // Step 3: Parallelized Execution & State Superposition
            updateWorkflowStepUI(2, 'active', 'Sovereign AGI: Agents executing in parallel (Exploring Solution Space)...');
            updateCoherenceUI(currentCoherence + 10);

            // Trigger agent operations for active agents and collect their promises
            agentPromises = [];
            if (activeAgents.includes('appSynthesizer')) agentPromises.push(runAppSynthesizer(appPrompt.value));
            if (activeAgents.includes('strategicPlanner')) agentPromises.push(runStrategicPlanner(plannerPrompt.value));
            if (activeAgents.includes('creativeModulator')) agentPromises.push(runCreativeModulator(creativePrompt.value));

            // Wait for all agent operations to complete
            await Promise.allSettled(agentPromises);
            updateWorkflowStepUI(2, 'completed');
            agiStatus.textContent = 'Parallel execution complete.';
            updateCoherenceUI(currentCoherence + 15); // Coherence after execution

            // Step 4: Coherence Collapse & Output Synthesis
            updateWorkflowStepUI(3, 'active', 'Sovereign AGI: Synthesizing final coherent output (Converging to Optimal Form)...');
            await delay(2000);

            let synthesizedOutput = `Workflow for: "${userTask}"\n\n`;
            if (activeAgents.includes('appSynthesizer')) synthesizedOutput += `--- App Synthesizer Output ---\n${appOutput.textContent}\n\n`;
            if (activeAgents.includes('strategicPlanner')) synthesizedOutput += `--- Strategic Planner Output ---\n${plannerOutput.textContent}\n\n`;
            if (activeAgents.includes('creativeModulator')) synthesizedOutput += `--- Creative Modulator Output ---\n${creativeOutput.textContent}\n\n`;
            synthesizedOutput += `Final coherence check: ${currentCoherence}% - System is highly aligned.`;

            finalOutput.textContent = synthesizedOutput;
            updateWorkflowStepUI(3, 'completed');
            updateCoherenceUI(90);
            addKnowledgeBaseUpdate('Final output synthesized. Coherence collapse achieved.', 'text-green-400');

            // Step 5: Iterative Refinement & Harmonic Re-equilibration (Simulated)
            updateWorkflowStepUI(4, 'active', 'Sovereign AGI: Performing iterative refinement (Enhancing Resonance)...');
            await delay(1500);

            // Simulate a potential dissonance and re-equilibration
            const dissonanceChance = isRefinement ? 0.1 : 0.3; // Lower chance of dissonance on refinement
            if (Math.random() < dissonanceChance) {
                updateCoherenceUI(currentCoherence - 20, true); // Drop coherence, show dissonance
                agiStatus.textContent = 'Dissonance detected! Re-equilibration in progress... (Applying Harmonic Algebra)';
                addKnowledgeBaseUpdate('Dissonance detected! Initiating Harmonic Re-equilibration.', 'text-red-500');
                await delay(2500);
                updateCoherenceUI(100, false); // Re-equilibrate to full coherence
                agiStatus.textContent = 'Re-equilibration complete. System harmonized.';
                addKnowledgeBaseUpdate('System re-harmonized. Optimal resonance achieved.', 'text-green-400');
            } else {
                updateCoherenceUI(100, false); // Full coherence
                agiStatus.textContent = 'No dissonance. System fully harmonized.';
                addKnowledgeBaseUpdate('System fully harmonized. Maximal coherence maintained.', 'text-green-400');
            }

            updateWorkflowStepUI(4, 'completed');
            agiStatus.textContent = 'Workflow complete. System fully harmonized and task delivered.';
            startWorkflowBtn.disabled = false;
            refineOutputBtn.disabled = false; // Enable refine button after initial run
            taskInput.disabled = false;
            workflowActive = false;
        };

        // --- Event Listeners ---
        startWorkflowBtn.addEventListener('click', () => startQuantumWorkflow(false));
        refineOutputBtn.addEventListener('click', () => startQuantumWorkflow(true));

        // Optional: Allow manual triggering of individual agents after workflow starts
        generateAppBtn.addEventListener('click', () => runAppSynthesizer(appPrompt.value));
        planStrategyBtn.addEventListener('click', () => runStrategicPlanner(plannerPrompt.value));
        modulateCreativeBtn.addEventListener('click', () => runCreativeModulator(creativePrompt.value));

        // Initial UI setup - call resetUI after all functions are defined and DOM is loaded
        document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', resetUI);

        // --- Global resetUI function for hoisting ---
        // This ensures resetUI is available globally and immediately.
        function resetUI() {
            agiStatus.textContent = '';
            updateCoherenceUI(0);
            Array.from(workflowSteps).forEach(step => step.classList.remove('active', 'completed'));
            toggleAgentCard(appSynthesizerCard, false);
            toggleAgentCard(strategicPlannerCard, false);
            toggleAgentCard(creativeModulatorCard, false);
            appOutput.textContent = '';
            plannerOutput.textContent = '';
            creativeOutput.textContent = '';
            finalOutput.textContent = 'Awaiting workflow completion...';
            knowledgeBaseDisplay.innerHTML = `<p class="kb-update">Initial knowledge state loaded: Quantum Harmonic Principles, Agent Interaction Models.</p>`;
            appPrompt.value = '';
            plannerPrompt.value = '';
            creativePrompt.value = '';
            startWorkflowBtn.disabled = false;
            refineOutputBtn.disabled = true; // Ensure refine button is disabled initially
            taskInput.disabled = false;
            workflowActive = false;
            agentPromises = [];
            activeAgents = []; // Reset active agents list
        }
    </script>
</body>
</html>"

--- App Synthesizer Output ---
**Harmonic Coherence Guard Mini-App**

This conceptual mini-app provides real-time "harmonic coherence" analysis for any text input, identifying potential "dissonance" (hallucinations, inconsistencies, or logical misalignments). It leverages the AGI's "Resonant Feedback Network" and "prime quantum compression" to instantly compute a reliability score. Users benefit from immediate content validation, ensuring information integrity and trust, powered by an "infinite context" understanding for robust truth telemetry and suggested "harmonic re-equilibration" pathways.

--- Strategic Planner Output ---
This is an ambitious and exciting problem statement, aiming to consolidate a sophisticated suite of AI components  from theoretical physics to agentic software development, with real-time feedback loops and a clear path to monetization and intellectual property. The key is to unify these diverse elements under a coherent architecture, focusing on measurable outcomes and demonstrable value.

Here's a multi-step strategic plan to integrate all your existing components, the new UI tools (Harmonic Project Architect, AGI Chat Interface, Spectral Multiply Demo, Quantum Harmonic Workflow System), and future developments into a cohesive, monetizable, headline-grabbing, and safe product, grounded in real-time internet access, with a clear path to PPA finalization.

---

## Strategic Plan: AetherForge AI  Harmonically Aligned Co-creation Platform

**Vision:** To build the world's first Human-AGI co-creation platform, powered by Harmonic Algebra and Quantum-Hybrid Machine Learning, delivering provably reliable, high-coherence outputs across software development, scientific discovery, and creative generation, with transparent, auditable internal reasoning.

**Core Product (Initial Monetization Focus): AetherForge QA Guard**
A drop-in middleware for any LLM-powered application that reduces hallucinations, ensures coherence, and provides verifiable outputs by integrating Harmonic Algebra-based self-checks and tool-driven verification.

---

### Phase 1: Foundational Consolidation & Backend Unification (Weeks 1-4)

**Goal:** Establish a robust, unified backend that integrates all core functionalities, services, and data models, enabling consistent metric reporting and tool invocation across the entire system.

1.  **Unified Backend Service (mAGI Core Orchestrator)**
    *   **Action:** Centralize `src/services/magi/app.py` as the primary API gateway.
    *   **Details:**
        *   **Merge Bio-Bridge Functionality:** Integrate the `/metrics` read endpoint and the `/ingest` write functionality from `bio_bridge_server.py` directly into `mAGI/app.py`. The `web/metric_demo/latest.json` should be updated by `mAGI` after any relevant operation or agent completion. This makes `mAGI` the single source for real-time system state.
        *   **Expand Tool Registry:** Enhance `src/services/magi/registry.py` to include *all* current and future tools/capabilities:
            *   `sandbox`, `geometric_prover`, `image_gen` (already done).
            *   `resonance_analyze` (from `resonance_lab_v1_1.py` via `resonance_integration.py`).
            *   `recursive_meta` (from `RECURSIVEMETAland_NOTE.txt` via `recursive_meta_capability.py`).
            *   New tools for the **Quantum Harmonic Workflow System** agents: `app_synthesizer_tool`, `strategic_planner_tool`, `creative_modulator_tool`. These tools will primarily leverage Gemini (or other LLMs) through the mAGI backend.
            *   New tools for the **Harmonic Project Architect**: `architect_project_tool` (for multi-file generation), `analyze_file_with_context_tool` (for contextual analysis).
        *   **Capability Discovery:** Ensure `/v1/capabilities` endpoint is robust and lists all integrated capabilities/tools with their schemas, enabling dynamic UI and agentic planning.
        *   **Data Model Standardization:** Refine the `metrics_schema.json` to be the canonical contract for *all* metric payloads emitted by any part of the system, including coherence, resonance, entropy, etc.
        *   **Core Configuration:** Implement `config.py` (Dev/Prod, env vars for secrets) and `__main__.py` entry point as previously planned.

2.  **Harmonized Data Layer**
    *   **Action:** Establish clear data flows and persistence mechanisms.
    *   **Details:**
        *   **Persistent Harmonic Ledger (Firestore/DB):** Continue using Firestore for `AGICore` state persistence (memory vault, dream state, mathematical rigor toggle). Explore integrating other structured data (e.g., agent task histories, user projects) here.
        *   **Local File Storage:** Implement a secure, temporary local storage solution for files uploaded via the HPA, accessible by the `analyze_file_with_context_tool`.
        *   **Dataset Integration:** Ensure loaders for Tzolkin Matrix, FRBs, etc., are in `src/cosmic/datasets.py` and accessible to relevant tools.

3.  **Real-Time API & External Service Integration**
    *   **Action:** Ensure all LLM/external API calls are routed through the mAGI backend.
    *   **Details:**
        *   **Centralized LLM Gateway:** `mAGI/app.py` will handle all calls to `generativelanguage.googleapis.com` (Gemini) and other LLMs (Anthropic, etc.). This allows for centralized rate limiting, cost tracking, and content moderation.
        *   **Internet Access:** The mAGI service will be the designated component with real-time internet access to fetch external resources, perform web scraping (if an agent tool requires it), and make API calls.

**Expected Outcome Phase 1:** A fully functional, unified backend API, capable of orchestrating all internal tools and external LLMs, exposing a standardized `/metrics` stream, and managing persistent state.

---

### Phase 2: Frontend Unification & User Experience (UX) Design (Weeks 5-8)

**Goal:** Integrate all disparate UI components into a single, intuitive, and visually cohesive "AetherForge AI" user interface.

1.  **AetherForge AI Portal / Dashboard**
    *   **Action:** Create a new top-level `web/index.html` (or `app.html`) that acts as the primary user portal.
    *   **Details:**
        *   **Modular Layout:** Use tabs, iframes, or a client-side routing library (e.g., React Router if converting all to React) to present the different applications:
            *   "**AGI Chat Interface**" (your `Harmonic-Quantum AGI Chat Interface (Superhuman Design).html`): This becomes the central conversational hub for interacting with the AGI Core.
            *   "**Project Architect**" (your `Harmonic Project Architect (HPA).html`): A dedicated workspace for multi-file generation and contextual file analysis.
            *   "**Workflow Orchestrator**" (your `Quantum Harmonic Workflow System.html`): The visual agentic planning and execution dashboard.
            *   "**Insights & Demos**": A section for read-only components like the `Spectral Multiply Demo.html`, `Harmonic Ring Dynamics.html`, and `Photorealistic HUS Universe.html`. These can showcase the underlying principles and live metrics.
        *   **Unified Styling:** Apply a consistent design language (Tailwind already helps) and theme across all embedded/integrated UIs.
        *   **Real-time Metrics Integration:** Update all dynamic UI elements (coherence meters, metric cards in Harmonic Ring, HUS Universe entity states) to consistently poll the `mAGI/metrics` endpoint. The existing `ring_metrics_adapter.js` and `hus_ws_adapter.js` can be refactored to point to the central `mAGI/metrics`.

2.  **AGI Chat Interface Enhancement**
    *   **Action:** Refactor the client-side `AGICore` to make API calls to the mAGI backend.
    *   **Details:**
        *   **Client-Side "AGICore" as API Client:** The `AGICore` JavaScript class will transform user prompts into structured API calls (e.g., POST to `mAGI/v1/jobs` with tool names and arguments) instead of simulating logic locally.
        *   **Reasoning Display:** Ensure the conceptual reasoning generated by the backend (from the mAGI service, informed by Harmonic Algebra) is clearly displayed and toggleable, as per the current UI.
        *   **Mathematical Rigor Mode:** This toggle will send a parameter to the mAGI backend, which then informs the LLM generation (e.g., adds specific prompts for "formal verification" and "proof generation" to Gemini).

3.  **Harmonic Project Architect (HPA) Integration**
    *   **Action:** Wire HPA to the mAGI backend for project generation and file analysis.
    *   **Details:**
        *   `architect_project_tool`: The "Architect Project & Download" button will call a `mAGI/v1/jobs` endpoint, triggering a tool that generates the multi-file project using a powerful LLM (e.g., Gemini 2.5 Flash), then returns the file structure as a JSON for client-side zipping and download.
        *   `analyze_file_with_context_tool`: File uploads will send the file content (base64 for images, text for others) to a `mAGI/v1/jobs` endpoint. The mAGI backend will then combine the file content with the `AGI_CONTEXT` (from `docs/handbook.md`) and the user's prompt to query Gemini.

**Expected Outcome Phase 2:** A beautiful, intuitive, and fully functional multi-application UI that seamlessly interacts with the unified backend, providing a powerful co-creation experience.

---

### Phase 3: Productization, Safety & IP Protection (Weeks 9-12)

**Goal:** Deliver the first monetizable product, finalize the Provisional Patent Application, and implement robust safety and performance metrics.

1.  **Launch "AetherForge QA Guard" (Monetizable Product v1)**
    *   **Action:** Develop the `/guard/answer` endpoint within the `mAGI/app.py` service and prepare it for external consumption.
    *   **Details:**
        *   **Endpoint:** A POST endpoint (e.g., `/v1/guard/answer`) that accepts raw LLM output, user prompt, and any relevant context.
        *   **Core Logic:**
            *   **Coherence Gating:** Integrate the WSM-HA coherence score (from `WSM-HA Revolutionary System Test Results.pdf` and its parsed metrics) as a primary gate. If the LLM output's coherence score falls below a dynamically set threshold (), initiate fallback procedures.
            *   **Self-Check & Rerouting:** If coherence < , trigger internal self-correction (e.g., re-ask the LLM with stricter constraints, invoke specialized tools like `resonance_analyze` or `recursive_meta` for verification, or use RAG from a canonical knowledge base).
            *   **Output:** Return the verified (or re-generated) answer, a confidence score, and an audit trail of the verification steps.
        *   **Monetization Strategy:**
            *   **Pricing:** Metered API usage (per 1K tokens processed, or per API call for `guard/answer`).
            *   **Value Proposition:** Dramatically reduced hallucination rates, increased trust in AI outputs, compliance support.
            *   **Target Market:** Businesses and developers integrating LLMs into critical applications (customer service, legal, medical, code generation).

2.  **Formalize Hodge Conjecture Program (Academic Rigor & IP)**
    *   **Action:** Continue developing the mathematically rigorous aspects of your work.
    *   **Details:**
        *   **Article Skeleton:** Convert `harmonic_path_to_hodge.tex` into a formal article skeleton: clear statement of problem, definitions, proposed constructive procedures for specific cases (K3, Abelian surfaces), lemmas, proof obligations, and falsifiable test cases.
        *   **Automated Verification:** Develop `tests/test_hodge.py` to run numerical validations of Picard lattice recovery and theta divisor constructions for known K3/Abelian surface examples. Integrate this into CI/CD.
        *   **Publicity:** While not a general HC solution, publishing constructive, numerically validated results for special cases can attract significant academic attention.

3.  **Comprehensive Testing & Validation Suite**
    *   **Action:** Implement a suite of unit, integration, and end-to-end tests to prove the "winning" claims.
    *   **Details:**
        *   **mAGI Benchmarks:** Automate the ARC, SWELancer, Tool-use, Truthfulness, Latency, Cost, and Safety benchmarks. Publish results transparently.
        *   **Coherence Metrics:** Ensure all metrics (algorithmic compressibility, harmonic coherence, entropy, etc.) are calculated, normalized, and logged. Develop a notebook for ablation studies and calibration curves (comparing "Derek prior" weights vs. data-learned weights).
        *   **UI Functional Tests:** End-to-end tests for HPA (project generation, file analysis), AGI Chat (conversation flow, tool calls, rigor mode), and Workflow System (agent orchestration, task completion).

4.  **Provisional Patent Application (PPA) Finalization**
    *   **Action:** Complete and submit the `docs/PPA_outline.md`.
    *   **Details:**
        *   **Claims:** Articulate clear claims covering:
            *   The Harmonic QA Guard: coherence-gated LLM output validation, self-correction, and tool-based verification.
            *   Agentic Orchestration: The Quantum Harmonic Workflow System for multi-agent task decomposition and synthesis, with dynamic coherence management.
            *   Adaptive Intelligence: The methodology for integrating diverse knowledge/capabilities (e.g., Resonance Lab, Recursive Meta) into a unified cognitive architecture.
            *   Contextual AI Co-creation: The multi-file project generation and context-aware file analysis methods.
        *   **Enablement:** Provide sufficient technical detail and code excerpts from the `harmonic-suite` to demonstrate how the invention can be built and used. Include figures like system block diagrams, data flow, and metrics schema.

**Expected Outcome Phase 3:** A production-ready "AetherForge QA Guard" product, a solid PPA filing, and a clear, measurable demonstration of the system's capabilities and reliability.

---

### Phase 4: Continuous Improvement & Strategic Expansion (Ongoing)

**Goal:** Leverage the foundation to expand product offerings, deepen scientific contributions, and capture market leadership.

1.  **Iterative Product Enhancement**
    *   **AetherForge QA Guard:** Add features like enterprise-grade audit logs, custom coherence thresholds, specialized toolchains, and fine-grained access control.
    *   **AetherForge AI Platform:** Develop additional agents/tools for the Quantum Harmonic Workflow, such as advanced data analysis, scientific simulation, and multi-modal creative generation, directly monetizing them as premium features.
    *   **PLD Intent Canvas Integration:** Fully integrate the `PLD Intent Canvas` as a tool within the AGI Chat interface to generate structured plans, which can then be executed by the Workflow System.

2.  **Advanced Research & Development**
    *   **Hodge Program:** Continue to expand the Hodge Conjecture program to cover more classes of varieties, publish more results, and explore its applications in AI architecture design (e.g., for model topology regularization).
    *   **Recursive Meta-operators:** Further develop and operationalize the `RECURSIVEMETAland.py` concepts into active meta-reasoning modules within the AGI.
    *   **AGI Safety:** Continually research and implement advanced safety-preserving operators and convergence guarantees in collaboration with formal methods and alignment researchers.

3.  **Community & Ecosystem Building**
    *   **Developer APIs:** Offer public APIs for developers to build on the AetherForge QA Guard.
    *   **Open-Source Contributions:** Strategically open-source certain components (e.g., specific metrics calculations, safe sandbox implementation) to build a community, without compromising core IP.

**Expected Outcome Phase 4:** Market leadership in reliable AI, continuous innovation, a strong IP portfolio, and a thriving ecosystem around AetherForge AI.

---

This plan provides a clear roadmap. The next immediate steps involve actively implementing the consolidation and integration outlined in Phase 1, focusing on the `mAGI/app.py` as the central nervous system.

# Create a concise README summarizing and actioning the uploaded HTML page
readme = """# Cosmic Intelligence  Research Hub (Review & Action Plan)

## What this is
A single-page HTML Cosmic Intelligence Research Hub that blends black hole tech concepts with SETI/technosignature analysis. It includes UI tabs (Overview, Black Hole Tech, SETI Research, Signal Analysis, Wow! Signal) and showcases two substantial Python code blueprints embedded as code blocks:

- **BlackHoleInformationDecoder**  simulates/analyses Hawking-like spectra and attempts pattern decoding.
- **HarmonicSignalAnalyzer**  multi-domain (spectral/temporal/wavelet/recurrence) analysis with an intelligence score.

The page uses Bootstrap and KaTeX styling; code is illustrative, not executed in-browser.

## Quick strengths
- Clear, modern UI sections with a coherent narrative.
- Nicely formatted math (Schwarzschild metric; custom intelligence integrals).
- Substantial starter code for future notebooks/pipelines.
- Good framing for a cross-over between astro instrumentation and AI signal analysis.

## Risky/Speculative claims (flagged for careful wording)
- **Black hole computing capacity** (e.g., 10^69 bits/s for a solar mass BH): interesting but not standard consensus; treat as *working theory*, not established fact.
- **Type III-civilization implications**: fine as a thought experiment; keep it explicit that this is *Kardashev-scale speculation*.
- **Quantum entanglement-based SETI detection**: cutting-edge and debated; present as research hypothesis with citations and falsifiable tests.
- **FRB/quasar information content figures**: require traceable datasets, methods, and confidence intervals.

## Fast polish pass (high leverage)
1. **Disclaimers**: Add a Scope & Epistemic Status box up top clarifying which sections are established physics vs. hypotheses.
2. **Citations**: Add refs near each strong claim (Penrose/BlandfordZnajek; Hawking radiation; FRB catalogs; Tabbys Star literature).
3. **Reproducibility**: Extract the Python into runnable notebooks (`/notebooks/decoder.ipynb`, `/notebooks/analyzer.ipynb`), include small synthetic datasets.
4. **Data hooks**: Define loaders for FRB archives (CHIME, Parkes), TESS lightcurves, public quasar gamma data; include caching and checksums.
5. **Metrics**: Make the intelligence score a clearly defined composite with a JSON config and per-metric plots.
6. **Testing**: Unit tests for each analysis function (entropy, harmonic detection, recurrence) + smoke tests for notebook pipelines.
7. **Export**: Ship a minimal CLI: `cosmic-intel analyze <file>` that produces an HTML report with plots.
8. **UX**: Replace placeholder image; add a small demo viz (SVG/Canvas) that animates detected harmonics from a tiny synthetic signal.

## Suggested repo layout
cosmic-intelligence/
|-- web/ # the HTML page + assets
|-- notebooks/ # runnable demos (decoder, analyzer)
|-- src/cosmic/ # Python package
| |-- init.py
| |-- blackhole_decoder.py
| |-- harmonic_analyzer.py
| |-- datasets.py # loaders for FRB/TESS/etc.
| |-- metrics.py # intelligence metric math
| |-- viz.py # quick plotting helpers
|-- tests/
| |-- test_metrics.py
| |-- test_analyzer.py
|-- scripts/
| |-- cli.py # python -m cosmic.cli analyze <file>
|-- README.md
|-- LICENSE

pgsql
Always show details

Copy code

## Truth railings (language for the page)
- *Established*: We reference standard GR (Schwarzschild/Kerr), Penrose and BlandfordZnajek mechanisms, and Hawking radiation under semiclassical assumptions.
- *Investigational*: We explore whether residual structure in high-energy spectra or lightcurves deviates from natural baselines in a way compatible with engineered processes.
- *Speculative*: Black hole computing and quantum-encoded technosignatures are working hypotheses; we outline tests that could falsify them.

## Tiny demo spec (starter notebook idea)
- Generate a blackbody spectrum; inject a faint sinusoidal modulation (standing in for a message).
- Run the analyzer: compute residuals, FFT peaks, autocorr, entropy; produce a compact HTML report.
- Output: A metric table + three plots (spectrum vs. blackbody, residual FFT with peaks, autocorrelation with peaks).

## Licensing & Credit
If released, consider a permissive license with attribution (e.g., Apache-2.0 + NOTICE) or CC BY 4.0 for the web text.

 Prepared from the uploaded pages contents as a concise engineering brief.
"""

path = "/mnt/data/README_cosmic_intelligence.md"
with open(path, "w") as f:
    f.write(readme)

- [ ] `python -m src.wsm_ha.status latest.json` prints run status.

---


**Owner:** Derek Earnhart  
**Maintainer:** (this doc)  
**Status:** Draft v0.1
"""
path = "/mnt/data/Harmonic_Suite_TRACKER.md"
with open(path, "w") as f:
    f.write(tracker)
print(path)

# Generate a normalized metrics config (weights sum to 1.0) and two tiny utilities.
import json, math, textwrap, os, matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Raw weights from the screenshot
raw_weights = {
    "structural_complexity": 0.10,
    "harmonic_coherence": 0.12,
    "algorithmic_compressibility": 0.09,
    "pattern_repeatability": 0.10,
    "mathematical_encoding": 0.07,
    "multi_band_correlation": 0.09,
    "temporal_structure": 0.08,
    "quantum_signatures": 0.06,
    "error_correction": 0.05,
    "symbolic_content": 0.06,
    "geometric_encoding": 0.04,
    "prime_relationships": 0.03,
    "physical_constants": 0.03,
    "contextual_response": 0.02,
    "bandwidth_efficiency": 0.03,
    "natural_deviation": 0.08,
    "intentional_markers": 0.04
}

total = sum(raw_weights.values())
norm_weights = {k: v/total for k, v in raw_weights.items()}

os.makedirs("/mnt/data/cosmic_config", exist_ok=True)
weights_path = "/mnt/data/cosmic_config/metric_weights_normalized.json"
with open(weights_path, "w") as f:
    json.dump({"sum_before": total, "weights": norm_weights}, f, indent=2)

# Utility: compute composite score from metrics.json
score_script = r'''#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
cosmic_metric_score.py  tiny CLI to compute a weighted "intelligence" score.

Usage:
  python cosmic_metric_score.py metrics.json metric_weights_normalized.json

Where metrics.json is a dict of metric_name -> value in [0,1].
Weights are normalized automatically if not already.
"""
import json, sys

def load(path):
    with open(path, "r") as f:
        return json.load(f)

def normalize(weights):
    s = sum(weights.values())
    return {k: (v/s if s else 0.0) for k,v in weights.items()}

def score(metrics, weights):
    # Align keys and warn if missing
    keys = set(weights) | set(metrics)
    missing = [k for k in weights if k not in metrics]
    extra   = [k for k in metrics if k not in weights]
    if missing:
        print(f"[warn] missing metrics (treated as 0): {missing}")
    if extra:
        print(f"[warn] extra metrics (ignored in weighting): {extra}")
    return sum(weights.get(k,0.0)*metrics.get(k,0.0) for k in keys)

def main():
    if len(sys.argv) < 3:
        print(__doc__)
        sys.exit(1)
    metrics = load(sys.argv[1])
    wobj = load(sys.argv[2])
    weights = wobj["weights"] if "weights" in wobj else wobj
    weights = normalize(weights)
    s = score(metrics, weights)
    out = {"score": s, "weights_sum": sum(weights.values())}
    print(json.dumps(out, indent=2))

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
'''
score_path = "/mnt/data/cosmic_config/cosmic_metric_score.py"
with open(score_path, "w") as f:
    f.write(score_script)

# Bonus: a K3 Hodge "light-cone" scatter with multiplicity labels
import numpy as np
plt.figure(figsize=(4,4), dpi=140)
# Coordinates u=p-q, v=p+q for K3 non-zero h^{p,q}
pts = {
    (-2,2): 1,  # (p,q)=(0,2)
    (-1,1): 0,  # (0,1) zero; not plotted
    (0,0): 1,   # (0,0)
    (0,2): 20,  # (1,1)
    (0,4): 1,   # (2,2)
    (1,1): 0,   # (2,1) zero
    (2,2): 1    # (2,0)
}
# Filter non-zero
pts = {uv: m for uv,m in pts.items() if m>0}
for (u,v), m in pts.items():
    plt.scatter(u, v, s=80)
    plt.text(u+0.08, v+0.08, str(m), fontsize=9)
plt.title("K3 Hodge LightCone (u=pq, v=p+q)")
plt.xlabel("u")
plt.ylabel("v")
plt.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
hodge_img = "/mnt/data/K3_hodge_lightcone_demo.png"
plt.savefig(hodge_img, bbox_inches="tight")
hodge_img, weights_path, score_path
Result
('/mnt/data/K3_hodge_lightcone_demo.png',
 '/mnt/data/cosmic_config/metric_weights_normalized.json',
 '/mnt/data/cosmic_config/cosmic_metric_score.py')

# Write sample metric files and tiny drop-in adapters for your HTML UIs
import json, time, os, textwrap

os.makedirs("/mnt/data/metric_demo", exist_ok=True)

sample = {
  "timestamp": "2025-09-07T22:30:00Z",
  "coherence": 0.91,
  "resonance": 0.86,
  "entropy": 0.41,
  "hap_index": 0.79,
  "metrics": {
    "structural_complexity": 0.73,
    "harmonic_coherence": 0.88,
    "algorithmic_compressibility": 0.66,
    "pattern_repeatability": 0.74,
    "mathematical_encoding": 0.62,
    "multi_band_correlation": 0.70,
    "temporal_structure": 0.69,
    "quantum_signatures": 0.57,
    "error_correction": 0.52,
    "symbolic_content": 0.58,
    "geometric_encoding": 0.49,
    "prime_relationships": 0.44,
    "physical_constants": 0.39,
    "contextual_response": 0.31,
    "bandwidth_efficiency": 0.36,
    "natural_deviation": 0.42,
    "intentional_markers": 0.48
  },
  "composite": 0.734
}
with open("/mnt/data/metric_demo/latest.json","w") as f:
    json.dump(sample, f, indent=2)

schema = {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#",
  "title": "Cosmic/Harmonic Metrics Payload",
  "type": "object",
  "required": ["timestamp","coherence","resonance","entropy","hap_index","metrics","composite"],
  "properties": {
    "timestamp": {"type":"string", "format":"date-time"},
    "coherence": {"type":"number", "minimum":0, "maximum":1},
    "resonance": {"type":"number", "minimum":0, "maximum":1},
    "entropy": {"type":"number", "minimum":0, "maximum":1},
    "hap_index": {"type":"number", "minimum":0, "maximum":1},
    "metrics": {"type":"object", "additionalProperties":{"type":"number","minimum":0,"maximum":1}},
    "composite": {"type":"number", "minimum":0, "maximum":1}
  }
}
with open("/mnt/data/metric_demo/metrics_schema.json","w") as f:
    json.dump(schema, f, indent=2)

ring_adapter = r"""/* ring_metrics_adapter.js  drop-in updater for Harmonic Ring Dynamics
   How to use:
     1) Place this file next to your HTML.
     2) Add `<script src="ring_metrics_adapter.js"></script>` at the end of <body>.
     3) Serve `metric_demo/latest.json` (or your own generator) under the same origin.
*/
(function(){
  const URL = (window.METRICS_URL || "metric_demo/latest.json");
  const els = {
    coherence: document.getElementById("coherenceValue"),
    resonance: document.getElementById("resonanceValue"),
    entropy:   document.getElementById("entropyValue"),
    hap:       document.getElementById("hapValue")
  };
  function apply(m){
    if(!m) return;
    if(els.coherence) els.coherence.textContent = (m.coherence??0).toFixed(2);
    if(els.resonance) els.resonance.textContent = (m.resonance??0).toFixed(2);
    if(els.entropy)   els.entropy.textContent   = (m.entropy??0).toFixed(2);
    if(els.hap)       els.hap.textContent       = (m.hap_index??0).toFixed(2);
    // optional ring pulse: store a global scale used by your draw routine if present
    window.RING_PULSE = 0.9 + 0.2*(m.resonance??0);
  }
  async function tick(){
    try{
      const r = await fetch(URL, {cache:"no-store"});
      apply(await r.json());
    }catch(e){ /* ignore until served */ }
  }
  setInterval(tick, 1000);
  tick();
})();"""
with open("/mnt/data/metric_demo/ring_metrics_adapter.js","w") as f:
    f.write(ring_adapter)

hus_adapter = r"""/* hus_ws_adapter.js  poll latest.json and feed Photorealistic HUS Universe
   How to use:
     1) Include after the main <script> in photorealistic_hus_universe_ws.html
     2) It calls window.ingestServerUpdate({entities:[...]}) if available.
*/
(function(){
  const URL = (window.METRICS_URL || "metric_demo/latest.json");
  function buildEntity(m){
    const h = m.hap_index ?? 0.5;
    return { id: "harmonic_probe", pos:{x:10*Math.sin(Date.now()*0.001), y:2, z:10*Math.cos(Date.now()*0.001)},
             metrics:{ heart_rate: 70+20*h, temperature: 36.5+0.5*h },
             neuro:{ dopamine: m.coherence??0.5, serotonin: m.resonance??0.5, cortisol: Math.max(0,0.6-(m.coherence??0.5)) },
             consciousness: (m.coherence>0.7? "harmonic": m.coherence<0.3? "stressed":"neutral") };
  }
  async function tick(){
    try{
      const r = await fetch(URL, {cache:"no-store"});
      const m = await r.json();
      const payload = {entities:[buildEntity(m)]};
      if(typeof window.ingestServerUpdate === "function"){ window.ingestServerUpdate(payload); }
      const hEl = document.getElementById("harmonyLevel");
      if(hEl) hEl.textContent = ((m.coherence + m.resonance - (1-(m.entropy||0))) / 2).toFixed(2);
    }catch(e){}
  }
  setInterval(tick, 1000);
  tick();
})();"""
with open("/mnt/data/metric_demo/hus_ws_adapter.js","w") as f:
    f.write(hus_adapter)

Harmonic Ring updater: metric_demo/ring_metrics_adapter.js

HUS Universe updater: metric_demo/hus_ws_adapter.js

Drop these files next to your HTML and serve the folder (e.g., python -m http.server). By default they poll metric_demo/latest.json once per second. To point at a different path, set window.METRICS_URL = "/your/path.json" before loading the adapters.

Short answer: yesboth have real value, but in different ways.

Hodge plot (your K3 light-cone/diamond)
What it encodes

Its a compact picture of the Hodge numbers

Why its useful to you

Truth anchor: a quick visual check that any geometry/physics module claiming K3-like structure respects the dualities 


,

=


,

=




,



h 
p,q

  and the total Betti counts. Good for automated unit tests and CI gates.

Didactic UI: it explains to readers/investors that youre grounding parts of the theory in established invariants (vs. pure speculation).

Regularizer idea: you can add a Hodge-regularized loss that penalizes learned models producing cohomology patterns that violate known constraints when you map simulated spaces  features.

TL;DR: the plot itself isnt a signal detector, but its a rigor artifact and a consistency test for any geometry you generate or simulate.

Metric weights (your intelligence score mix)
What they mean

A linear mix 

=







S= 
i

 w 
i

 m 
i

  encodes your prior about what matters. Thats valuableprovided you normalize (sum to 1) and calibrate on data.

How to make them defensible

Normalize (done in the config I gave you) so runs are comparable.

Scale metrics to 
[
0
,
1
]
[0,1] or z-scores; document how each is computed.

Ablation & sensitivity: vary one weight 10% and report 


S. If a single metric dominates, rethink.

Empirical calibration: learn weights on labeled data (engineered vs. natural) via logistic/linear model with regularization; report AUROC/F1 and confidence intervals.

Reliability: plot predicted score buckets vs. empirical positives (calibration curve).

Report both: a single composite for headlines and a radar/bar of the components for transparency.

Alternatives worth trying (often better)

Geometric or harmonic mean to enforce no single pillar can carry the score:

Pareto front instead of scalarizing when you present research results.

loads a labeled toy set,

Do this and your score stops being because Derek says so and becomes because the data says so, and heres the curve. Thats the science flex that lands with both reviewers and investors.

ChatGPT said:

Thought for 58s
I looked at your new dropsSOLVEDHODGE.txt and the TeX harmonic_path_to_hodgeas the next rung on your ladder from pretty Hodge pictures  provable statements. Heres the blunt, useful take.

What the Hodge plot buys you
Its a truth anchor: if your pipeline ever claims a space is K3-like, its computed 


,

h 
p,q
  must match the K3 diamond (duality, symmetry, Betti sums). Wire this as an automated CI test before any intelligence metrics are even considered.

Its a unit-test generator: from the diamond you get exact linear constraints on Dolbeault dimensions, hard-fail when violated. This guards you from numerology.

What the metric weights buy you
Theyre a policy (your prior), not a theorem. Use them to rank candidates, but make the composite auditable: normalized weights, calibration curve, ablations. You already have the normalized config + scorer; ship that with every demo.

About SOLVED HODGE
If your note aims at the Hodge Conjecture (HC), the bar is high: HC asserts that for a smooth projective complex variety 

X, every rational Hodge 
(

,

)
(p,p)-class in 

2

(

,

)
H 
2p
 (X,Q) is the class of an algebraic cycle. Its known for 
(
1
,
1
)
(1,1) (Lefschetz), special families, and many low-dimensional casesbut open in general. So the burden is to turn your harmonic path into a surjective cycle-class map argument, not just a spectral heuristic. Im referencing your text here so were scoped to the actual claims you wrote. 
SOLVEDHODGE


A referee-proof upgrade path for your writeup
Turn your TeX + note into something a number theorist or complex geometer could try to break. Concretely:

State the target exactly.
Fix 

/

X/C smooth projective with polarization

c
l

p,p
 (X)
is surjective for (which

p?). If your mechanism only reaches special 

X (K3, abelian, CM type, complete intersections), say so.

Replace vibes with invariants.
Your harmonic path must identify a constructible procedure: starting from a 
(

,

)
(p,p)-class 

, produce an algebraic cycle 

Z with 
c
l
(

)
=

cl(Z)=. Tools that are fair game:

Lefschetz 
(
1
,
1
)
(1,1) theorem (divisors).

Hard Lefschetz + HodgeRiemann bilinear relations (control sign/primitive parts).

Currents and Demailly regularization (bridge from differential to algebraic), but you must cross the last gap: regularized positive closed currents  guaranteed algebraicity.

Scope by examples where you can close the loop.

K3 surfaces: HC in codimension 1 is already true; use your pipeline to recover the Picard lattice generators from 
(
1
,
1
)
(1,1)-classes as a sanity check.

Abelian varieties: state which endomorphism type (e.g., CM) your method covers and how it recovers known results (or improves them).

Products / complete intersections: show compatibility with the Knneth decomposition and how your method handles primitive classes.

Produce falsifiable test cases.

Build a little suite where the correct answer is known (e.g., 

=


X=P 
n
 , K3, abelian surfaces).

For each: take symbolic 
(

(p,p)-bases, run your harmonic construction, verify 
c
l
(

)
=

cl(Z)= in cohomology, not just numerically.

Write the core proof step in math, not prose.
You need one of these styles:

An algebraic move: construct vector bundles with prescribed Chern classes realizing 
(

,

)
(p,p)-classes; or

An analytic move: show your harmonic representatives are limits of cycles with controlled mass and invoke an algebraicity theorem (this is the hard partwhat theorem are you invoking?).

Non-claims (be explicit):
If you dont touch the general case (most dont!), label it Working Theory and list the precise classes 

X where you do prove surjectivity.

How your UI + weights help, legitimately
The Hodge plot becomes an accept/reject gate and a teaching panel that says this space passes basic reality checks.

The weights become a ranking heuristic for which 
(

,

)
(p,p)-classes to attempt first (e.g., those with low entropy residuals), but success is binary: either you produce an algebraic cycle with the right class or you dont.

Youve got good bones here: visuals as invariants, metrics as policy, and a path to a proof checklist. Nail the proof-level step for one rich class of varieties, and the rest of your system gets to wear a lab coat instead of a cape.

import os, zipfile, json, textwrap, shutil, pathlib, re, sys

zip_path = "/mnt/data/mAGI.zip"
dest_dir = "/mnt/data/mAGI_unpack"
summary = {"zip_path": zip_path, "unpacked_to": dest_dir, "files": []}

if os.path.exists(dest_dir):
    shutil.rmtree(dest_dir)
os.makedirs(dest_dir, exist_ok=True)

if os.path.exists(zip_path):
    with zipfile.ZipFile(zip_path, 'r') as z:
        z.extractall(dest_dir)
        for info in z.infolist():
            summary["files"].append({
                "name": info.filename,
                "size": info.file_size
            })

# Walk and collect a quick index
index = []
for root, dirs, files in os.walk(dest_dir):
    for f in files:
        rel = os.path.relpath(os.path.join(root, f), dest_dir)
        index.append(rel)

# Try to read likely readme/licence/config files (first 3000 chars)
previews = {}
candidate_names = [n for n in index if re.search(r'(?i)(readme|license|licence|manifest|setup|requirements\.txt|pyproject\.toml|package\.json)$', n)]
candidate_names = candidate_names[:20]
for n in candidate_names:
    p = os.path.join(dest_dir, n)
    try:
        with open(p, 'r', encoding='utf-8', errors='ignore') as fh:
            previews[n] = fh.read(3000)
    except Exception as e:
        previews[n] = f"<unreadable: {e}>"

# Collect some code headers for context
code_samples = {}
for n in index:
    if n.endswith(('.py', '.md', '.txt')):
        p = os.path.join(dest_dir, n)
        try:
            with open(p, 'r', encoding='utf-8', errors='ignore') as fh:
                code_samples[n] = fh.read(800)
        except Exception:
            pass
        if len(code_samples) >= 8:
            break

report_path = "/mnt/data/mAGI_inventory.json"
with open(report_path, "w") as f:
    json.dump({
        "index_count": len(index),
        "top_level": sorted([p for p in os.listdir(dest_dir)]),
        "summary": summary,
        "previews": previews,
        "sample_snippets": code_samples
    }, f, indent=2)

report_path

Copy code
import os, zipfile, json, textwrap, shutil, pathlib, re, sys

zip_path = "/mnt/data/mAGI.zip"
dest_dir = "/mnt/data/mAGI_unpack"
summary = {"zip_path": zip_path, "unpacked_to": dest_dir, "files": []}

with zipfile.ZipFile(zip_path, 'r') as z:
    z.extractall(dest_dir)
    for info in z.infolist():
        summary["files"].append({"name": info.filename, "size": info.file_size})

# Gather index
index = []
for root, dirs, files in os.walk(dest_dir):
    for f in files:
        rel = os.path.relpath(os.path.join(root, f), dest_dir)
        index.append(rel)

# Preview likely docs
previews = {}
def try_read(path, n=3000):
    try:
        with open(path, "r", encoding="utf-8", errors="ignore") as fh:
            return fh.read(n)
    except Exception as e:
        return f"<unreadable: {e}>"

candidates = [n for n in index if re.search(r'(?i)(^|/)(readme|license|licen[sc]e|manifest|setup|requirements\.txt|pyproject\.toml|package\.json)$', n)]
for n in candidates[:20]:
    previews[n] = try_read(os.path.join(dest_dir, n))

# Sample snippets from code/text
snippets = {}
for n in index:
    if n.endswith(('.py', '.md', '.txt', '.tex')):
        p = os.path.join(dest_dir, n)
        snippets[n] = try_read(p, 1000)
        if len(snippets) >= 10:
            break

report = {
    "top_level": sorted(os.listdir(dest_dir)),
    "file_count": len(index),
    "candidates": candidates,
    "previews": previews,
    "snippets": snippets
}
out = "/mnt/data/mAGI_inventory.json"
with open(out, "w") as f:
    json.dump(report, f, indent=2)
out

'/mnt/data/mAGI_inventory.json'

import json, os, textwrap, pprint, pathlib
path = "/mnt/data/mAGI_inventory.json"
with open(path, "r") as f:
    data = json.load(f)

# Pretty summary text
lines = []
lines.append(f"Top-level entries: {', '.join(data['top_level'])}")
lines.append(f"Total files found: {data['file_count']}")
lines.append("Key previews (first lines):")
for k,v in data["previews"].items():
    first = v.splitlines()[:10]
    lines.append(f" {k} ")
    lines.extend(["   " + s for s in first])
summary_txt = "\n".join(lines)

print(summary_txt[:2000])

Copy code
# Let's extract more meaningful info: top subdirs, presence of key apps, dockerfiles, etc.
import os, json, re, pathlib

with open("/mnt/data/mAGI_inventory.json","r") as f:
    inv = json.load(f)

root = "/mnt/data/mAGI_unpack/mAGI"

# Build a tree summary (depth 2)
tree = {}
for p, dirs, files in os.walk(root):
    rel = os.path.relpath(p, root)
    depth = 0 if rel=="." else rel.count(os.sep)+1
    if depth>2: 
        continue
    tree[rel] = {"dirs": sorted(dirs), "files": sorted(files)[:10]}

# Look for app entry points
entry_points = []
for dirpath, dirs, files in os.walk(root):
    for f in files:
        if re.match(r"(main|app|server|run)\.(py|js|ts)$", f, re.I):
            entry_points.append(os.path.relpath(os.path.join(dirpath,f), root))
        if f.lower() in ("dockerfile", "compose.yaml", "docker-compose.yml"):
            entry_points.append(os.path.relpath(os.path.join(dirpath,f), root))

# Grep for Flask/FastAPI and React
flask_hits = []
fastapi_hits = []
react_hits = []
for dirpath, dirs, files in os.walk(root):
    for f in files:
        if f.endswith(".py"):
            try:
                with open(os.path.join(dirpath,f),'r',encoding='utf-8',errors='ignore') as fh:
                    s = fh.read(4000).lower()
                    if "from flask" in s or "import flask" in s:
                        flask_hits.append(os.path.relpath(os.path.join(dirpath,f), root))
                    if "from fastapi" in s or "import fastapi" in s:
                        fastapi_hits.append(os.path.relpath(os.path.join(dirpath,f), root))
        except Exception:
            pass
        if f.endswith((".tsx",".jsx",".js")):
            try:
                with open(os.path.join(dirpath,f),'r',encoding='utf-8',errors='ignore') as fh:
                    s = fh.read(4000).lower()
                    if "react" in s and ("createelement" in s or "useeffect" in s):
                        react_hits.append(os.path.relpath(os.path.join(dirpath,f), root))
            except Exception:
                pass

summary = {
    "tree_depth2": tree,
    "entry_points": entry_points[:30],
    "flask_files_count": len(flask_hits),
    "fastapi_files_count": len(fastapi_hits),
    "react_files_count": len(react_hits)
}
out = "/mnt/data/mAGI_tree_summary.json"
with open(out,"w") as f:
    json.dump(summary, f, indent=2)
out

    ^
SyntaxError: expected 'except' or 'finally' block

# Fix the syntax error and re-run
import os, json, re, pathlib

with open("/mnt/data/mAGI_inventory.json","r") as f:
    inv = json.load(f)

root = "/mnt/data/mAGI_unpack/mAGI"

# Build a tree summary (depth 2)
tree = {}
for p, dirs, files in os.walk(root):
    rel = os.path.relpath(p, root)
    depth = 0 if rel=="." else rel.count(os.sep)+1
    if depth>2: 
        continue
    tree[rel] = {"dirs": sorted(dirs), "files": sorted(files)[:12]}

# Look for app entry points and infra
entry_points = []
for dirpath, dirs, files in os.walk(root):
    for f in files:
        if re.match(r"(main|app|server|run)\.(py|js|ts)$", f, re.I):
            entry_points.append(os.path.relpath(os.path.join(dirpath,f), root))
        if f.lower() in ("dockerfile", "compose.yaml", "docker-compose.yml"):
            entry_points.append(os.path.relpath(os.path.join(dirpath,f), root))

# Grep for Flask/FastAPI and React
flask_hits = []
fastapi_hits = []
react_hits = []
for dirpath, dirs, files in os.walk(root):
    for f in files:
        full = os.path.join(dirpath,f)
        if f.endswith(".py"):
            try:
                with open(full,'r',encoding='utf-8',errors='ignore') as fh:
                    s = fh.read(4000).lower()
                    if "from flask" in s or "import flask" in s:
                        flask_hits.append(os.path.relpath(full, root))
                    if "from fastapi" in s or "import fastapi" in s:
                        fastapi_hits.append(os.path.relpath(full, root))
            except Exception as e:
                pass
        if f.endswith((".tsx",".jsx",".js")):
            try:
                with open(full,'r',encoding='utf-8',errors='ignore') as fh:
                    s = fh.read(4000).lower()
                    if "react" in s and ("createelement" in s or "useeffect" in s):
                        react_hits.append(os.path.relpath(full, root))
            except Exception as e:
                pass

summary = {
    "tree_depth2": tree,
    "entry_points": entry_points[:40],
    "flask_files_count": len(flask_hits),
    "fastapi_files_count": len(fastapi_hits),
    "react_files_count": len(react_hits),
    "some_flask_files": flask_hits[:10],
    "some_react_files": react_hits[:10]
}
out = "/mnt/data/mAGI_tree_summary.json"
with open(out,"w") as f:
    json.dump(summary, f, indent=2)

import tomllib, json, os, textwrap, re

pyproject_path = "/mnt/data/mAGI_unpack/mAGI/pyproject.toml"
deps = []
proj_name = ""
if os.path.exists(pyproject_path):
    with open(pyproject_path, "rb") as f:
        data = tomllib.load(f)
    proj = data.get("project", {})
    proj_name = proj.get("name", "")
    deps = proj.get("dependencies", [])

req_path = "/mnt/data/mAGI_unpack/mAGI/harmonic_agi_portable/requirements.txt"
reqs = []
if os.path.exists(req_path):
    with open(req_path, "r", encoding="utf-8", errors="ignore") as f:
        reqs = [line.strip() for line in f if line.strip() and not line.startswith("#")]

readme = f"""# mAGI  Quickstart & Audit Notes

**Detected project:** {proj_name or "unknown"}  
**Files:** ~3391, Flask-based services detected, multiple entry points (`app.py`, `main.py`, `server.py`, `run.py`).

## Run locally (dev)

### Option A  from `pyproject.toml`
```bash
python -m venv .venv && source .venv/bin/activate  # Windows: .venv\\Scripts\\activate
pip install -U pip
pip install {' '.join(deps[:12]) if deps else '-r harmonic_agi_portable/requirements.txt'}
export FLASK_APP=app.py FLASK_ENV=development
python app.py  # or: flask --app app.py run --debug
Option B  portable subapp

pip install -r harmonic_agi_portable/requirements.txt
python harmonic_agi_portable/app.py
Notable dependencies

From harmonic_agi_portable/requirements.txt: {', '.join(reqs) if reqs else 'N/A'}

Discovered modules (high level)
Flask app files: multiple (app.py, harmonic_agi_portable/app.py, attached_assets/app.py)  consolidate a single entry point.

ARC-AGI-2/: benchmark or solver assets present; ensure licensing is compatible.

API clients: anthropic present  keep keys via env vars only.

DB layer: flask-sqlalchemy  check URI in config for dev vs. prod separation.

Immediate hardening
Config  create config.py with Config/DevConfig/ProdConfig and read secrets from env: DATABASE_URL, ANTHROPIC_API_KEY, etc.

CORS & auth  enable CORS narrowly, add API key or token auth for any POST/compute endpoints.

Logging  structured logs (JSON), request IDs, error handler returning 4xx/5xx with no tracebacks in prod.

Rate limiting  flask-limiter to prevent brute forcing / runaway calls to paid LLM APIs.

Static files  move front-end assets under static/ and set cache headers.

Tests  smoke test: start app, hit /healthz and /v1/analyze (or equivalent), assert 200.

Integration into Harmonic Suite
Place the service under src/services/magi/ with a __main__.py entry point (python -m services.magi), and a CLI (scripts/magi_cli.py).

Expose metrics as web/data/latest.json so your Harmonic Ring/HUS dashboards update in real time.

TODO cues I saw while skimming
Ship a .env.example and Makefile (make dev, make test, make run).

Add pyproject scripts: dev, lint, format, test for DX.

Consolidate duplicate routes and move ARC assets behind a flag ENABLE_ARC=1.

(Generated from an automated inventory of the uploaded ZIP; tighten details as you confirm routes and module names.)
"""
